p:
We used the DPPH method for the measurement of radical scavenging activity, according to Ananthi et al. [ 44], with slight modifications. About 10 mg of each sample extract was dissolved in 1 mL of ethanol 70%. We added 100 µL of sample solution into a 96-well plate and then mixed it with 100 µL of DPPH 125 µM (in ethanol). The mixture was incubated at 37 °C for 30 min, and the absorbance was measured at 517 nm. The percentage of scavenging activity of the extract was calculated by using the following equation:
(1)

activity

where A = absorbance of sample, B = absorbance of sample correction, C = absorbance of blank, and D = absorbance correction of the blank. Antioxidant activity was determined using the following equation: y = 0.06665x − 0.0333, with R 2 = 0.9984. Quercetin was used as the standard.
